goals.question: What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of temperature values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the humidity vary with respect to time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of humidity over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any trends or patterns in the humidity levels over time and understand how they vary with respect to different seasons or months.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation or patterns between wind speed and temperature and understand how they affect each other.

goals.question: What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of pressure values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the precipitation vary with respect to location?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of precipitation by location
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any differences in precipitation levels across different locations and understand how they vary with respect to different seasons or months.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['temperature'] = pd.to_numeric(data['temperature'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='temperature', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['temperature'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['temperature'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['temperature'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['temperature'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='humidity', data=data)
    plt.title('How does the humidity vary with respect to time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.scatterplot(x='wind_speed', y='temperature', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['pressure'] = pd.to_numeric(data['pressure'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='pressure', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['pressure'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.axvline(data['pressure'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    data['month_year'] = data['date'].dt.strftime('%Y-%m')
    data = data.groupby(['location', 'month_year'])['precipitation'].mean().reset_index()
    sns.set_style("whitegrid")
    chart = sns.catplot(x="location", y="precipitation", hue="month_year", data=data, kind="bar", height=6, aspect=2)
    chart.set_xticklabels(rotation=90)
    plt.title('How does the precipitation vary with respect to location?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
